titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the George B. Marquis Papers 1863-1967
titlestmt.author: Henry Adams

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-07-16.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard), 2nd Edition.

physdesc.extent: 10 manuscript boxes, 2 record cartons, 1 flat box

did.abstract: George Bruce Marquis was born on July 6, 1879, and worked as the chief financial officer for Whitman College in Walla Walla, Washington until his retirement in 1949. The George B. Marquis papers, which date from 1863 to 1967, consist of books by Marquis and others, photographs of family members, manuscripts, published articles, a portrait, assorted speeches, correspondence, publications, poetry, a diploma, and newspaper clippings.

acqinfo.p: Donated to the Whitman College Northwest Archives by Eunice B. Westerkamp in May of 1976. The accession number associated with this donation is retro-0704.

bioghist.p: George Bruce Marquis was born on July 6, 1879. He attended Whitman College in Walla Walla, Washington from 1901 to 1905. He worked as the chief financial officer for Whitman until his retirement in 1949. He was a prolific writer, known for his adventure tales of the West. He died on February 20, 1955, at the age of 75.

scopecontent.p: The George B. Marquis papers house the personal papers of George B. Marquis. This collection, which dates from 1863 to 1967, consists of books by Marquis and others, photographs of family members, manuscripts, published articles, a portrait, assorted speeches, correspondence, publications, poetry, a diploma, and newspaper clippings.
